fullplot: In toney Brentwood, Benjamin Fiedler prepares for his bar mitzvah; trouble is, he understands neither its meaning nor the Hebrew, and his parents (particularly his successful-agent father) are planning the most lavish party possible. Benjamin wants his dad to give him some space, so he gets an idea: to invite his grandfather, who left the family years ago and for whom Benjamin's dad has an intense dislike, to come two weeks early. Thanks in part to grandpa - and to the immediate family's love - Benjamin may have a shot at figuring out what it means to be a man.
plot: A 13-year-old boy uses his upcoming bar mitzvah to reconcile the strained relationship between his father and grandfather.
title: Keeping Up with the Steins

tomatoes.consensus: Keeping Up With the Steins is one of those comedies that play more like a corny sitcom than a theatrical movie.
